bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 16, 1899

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 16, 1899
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P.M.
BALTIMORE. June 16. 99
My dear Mother,-
div1.p:
I am glad you
engaged the rooms at the Hames
house. I think that would be
much better than the other. I
remember the house very well.
It always looked attractive
I saw Miss Lilly Keighler a
few days ago. She and Miss
Mary are going up on Monday.
Mabel and I were out at
Windsor on Wednesday and
Aunt Kate and Frances were
in to lunch on yesterday.
Aunt Kate has not been
well but is feeling better
now.

You have not said anything
about the May's are
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P.M.
BALTIMORE.
you still, the only boarder?
I had a letter from Uncle
Tom. He says Aunt Alice
still has asthma.

Mabel expects to reach Hatley on
Wednesday morning June 21. Will
you please have some vehicle there
to meet her.
